review_title: DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS JOB
job_title: Residence Life Coordinator in Wolfville, NS
pros: The student staff are wonderful to work with, and you really do feel like you make an impact on the students.
cons: Never have I experienced such a lack of support in a student services role. Management is non-existent and does not care about the wellbeing of the staff. Staff are over-worked, and are not given the resources or support they need to make the changes that upper management is asking. Concerns are not heard or listened to. Benefits are essentially non-existent and you are not properly informed about them to begin with. After dealing with crisis' management does very little to check in.  Very little opportunity for professional development, which is incredibly disappointing as student services in a growing area.

pros: Acadia is a great place to work. Professors are friendly, and interested in your research. Wolfville is a nice community and the weather is great.
cons:
The only downside of working at Acadia is having to drive to New Minas to get groceries, etc.
There are limited options for food/nightlife as well.

pros: No hassle, quite town, easy to get around.
cons: People can get really cliquey, at all levels, from students upwards. There's a big lack of diversity on the campus, one can feel isolated very easily. Over the span of a year, there has been 3 deaths, 2 being on campus.
